attributes.action: demand an immediate re-count into the Irish Referendum results on the Lisbon Treaty.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under Irish law, the ballot boxes are to be delivered by the police to the polling stations on the day of the vote.

This was not the case on the day of the Irish referendum on the Lisbon Treaty.

Instead, the ballot boxes were delivered 48 hours early to the private residences of the polling/returning officers.

This leaves wide open possibility of fraud and stuffing the boxes with "Yes" votes to please British government policy and Brussels.

A human being's will must be respected, even if that is of a nation of human beings saying no twice.

An immediate re-count must take place and should fraud be found, then this latest "result" should be declared null and void.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
